title: 5 must-watch movies & TV shows streaming right now
author: Kevin Slane
bullets: "Apocalypse Now (Redux)" featuring Robert Duvall is streaming on Pluto TV and Plex.
"Blue Moon," a 2025 Richard Linklater biopic, is available on Netflix.
Jennifer Garner stars in "The Last Thing He Told Me" Season 2, streaming on Apple TV.

title: Red Sox INF Marcelo Mayer has to earn spot on Opening Day roster, Alex Cora says
author: Kaley Brown
bullets: Red Sox manager Alex Cora says Marcelo Mayer must prove himself offensively to secure an Opening Day roster spot.
Mayer batted .228 in 44 games last season and aims to use spring training to improve and make the team.
Mayer is primarily practicing at second base this spring, competing with newly acquired infielder Caleb Durbin.

title: 6 maps predicting snowfall totals Sunday-Monday
author: John Waller
bullets: A significant snowstorm is forecast for Sunday night into Monday, with the heaviest impact on southeast Massachusetts and Rhode Island.
Meteorologists predict heavy snow, strong winds, and coastal flooding, with potential for a foot or more of snow in metro Boston.
Power outages are a concern due to heavy, wet snow and high winds during the expected storm event Sunday into Monday.

title: Lindsay Clancy appears in court for first in-person hearing since allegedly killing her children
author: Abby Patkin
bullets: Lindsay Clancy appeared in Plymouth Superior Court for her first in-person hearing since the alleged murder of her three children.
Clancy, using a wheelchair, is charged with three counts of murder and strangulation of her children in January 2023.
Her defense plans to argue Clancy's insanity at trial, citing heavy medication and postpartum mental illness as factors.

title: Cape Cod adopts transfer fee on home sales over $1 million
author: Beth Treffeisen
bullets: Barnstable County Assembly approved a measure for a real estate transfer fee on home sales over $1 million.
The proposed fee could generate $60 million annually for housing, with 90% of funds returning to local towns.
The measure requires approval from the state legislature and support from Cape Cod's legislative delegation.

title: Peabody police warn about ‘Northshore Mall takeover’
author: Samantha Genzer
bullets: Peabody police alert public of a scheduled 'Northshore Mall takeover' at 3 p.m. Friday, focusing on public safety.
Such events have involved car burnouts and large crowds; recent similar incidents have occurred in Boston and elsewhere.
Gov. Maura Healey condemned these meetups, announcing a $14 million safety grant for prevention and response efforts.

title: 7 members of ‘Harvard Street Gang’ face drug and firearms charges, authorities say
author: Samantha Genzer
bullets: Eight defendants, including seven alleged Harvard Street Gang members, face federal drug and firearms charges in Massachusetts.
Authorities seized 25 firearms, large quantities of cocaine, fentanyl, marijuana, and $40,000 cash in the investigation.
The gang, under investigation since 2019, is linked to over 20 arrests, involving drug trafficking and violent crimes.

title: Al Horford says his decision to leave Celtics was ‘deeper than just the basketball’
author: Khari A. Thompson
bullets: Al Horford left the Celtics for the Golden State Warriors citing reasons beyond basketball for his departure.
Horford spent seven seasons with the Celtics, winning his only NBA title with the team.
Celtics coach Joe Mazzulla praised Horford, calling him a Hall-of-Famer and valuing their professional relationship.

title: Readers agree: Build a new Madison Park to benefit Bostonâ€™s youth
author: Annie Jonas
bullets: Boston.com readers advocate for rebuilding Madison Park Technical Vocational High School on the vacant 7.7-acre parcel P-3 in Roxbury.
Support for investing in vocational education outweighs mixed-use development as readers emphasize the need for career pathways in trades.
The proposal reflects calls to update Boston Public Schools' infrastructure and improve education quality for Boston's youth.

title: Planned Parenthood rolls out vasectomies at Mass. health centers
author: Beth Treffeisen
bullets: Planned Parenthood League of Massachusetts now offers vasectomies at its health centers, starting in Worcester.
Demand for vasectomies increased after the Dobbs decision and Trump's reelection, with bookings rising by 1,200%.
Patients must attend in-person consultations before vasectomy, available at four Massachusetts health centers.
